page.title: 10CHURCH
page.content: There was a church in PEWSEY in Saxon times. Onthe south side of the present buiding can be seen several stones. There are thought to be foundations of the tiny church of{KING ALFRED'S time.Later a Norman church of stone was built in a much smaller size than the existing church . During Mediaeval times much enlargement took place. The roof was raised, the tower was built and the present pillars were cut from the original Norman walls. The altar rails were made of wood given by Lord Nelson. The parish register began in 1586. The church is dedicated to St John the Baptist.
